title: Regulation (EEC) No 651/71 of the Commission of 29 March 1971 on certain detailed rules for the application of export refunds on oil seeds
header:
REGULATION (EEC) No 651/71 OF THE COMMISSION  of 29 March 1971  on certain detailed rules for the application of export refunds on oil seeds
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The amount of the export refund shall be calculated on the basis of the weight of exported seeds determined in accordance with the formula set out in the Annex so as to take account of differences between the percentages of moisture and impurities found to exist and those used to define the standard quality for which the target price is fixed.
The methods used for drawing samples, for reducing contract samples to samples for analysis and for determining impurities and moisture shall be uniform throughout the Community.
The refund shall not be granted in respect of the seeds defined in Article 1 of Commission Regulation (EEC) No 190/68 1 of 16 January 1968 on the denaturing process for colza and rape seed.

Where Article 11 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 2637/70 is applied, the refund shall be paid subject to the condition laid down in Article 5 (1) of Regulation No 142/67/EEC and upon proof that the product has reached the destination for which the licence was issued.
Regulations Nos 284/67/EFC and 901/67/EEC are hereby repealed.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
